docs.snippet: In lieu of the annual festival dinner of this Association, a public meeting of the Board of Directors was held yesterday at I P. M., in the Metropolitan Hotel. The attendance was small, comparatively, though the pleasurable interest with which these...
docs.lead_paragraph: In lieu of the annual festival dinner of this Association, a public meeting of the Board of Directors was held yesterday at I P. M., in the Metropolitan Hotel. The attendance was small, comparatively, though the pleasurable interest with which these demonstrations have herebefore been invested, did not appeal in any way to be diminished.

docs.snippet: PETER B. SWEENEY, Esq., District-Attorney, has been directed by his physician to take a sea voyage for the benefit of his health. He expects to be gone about four weeks, during which time JOHN MCKEON, Esq., late United States District-Attorney, will...
docs.lead_paragraph: PETER B. SWEENEY, Esq., District-Attorney, has been directed by his physician to take a sea voyage for the benefit of his health. He expects to be gone about four weeks, during which time JOHN MCKEON, Esq., late United States District-Attorney, will perform his official duties.

headline.main: ARRIVAL OF THE MOSES TAYLOR.; Arrival of Ex-President Juarez and Cabinet at Aspinwall. The Treaty with New-Granada not yet Ratified. SANGUINARY BATTLE IN PERU. Utter Rout of the Revolutionists and Flight of their Chiefs. Extension of Time to White, Stebbins & Co. to Open the Transit. Revival of the Nicaraguan Steamship War. $1,486,565 in Treasure. TWO WEEKS LATER FROM CALIFORNIA. Important from Central and South America. RATIFICATION OF THE YRISARRI TREATY.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States Mail steamship Moses Taylor, JOHN MCGOWAN, Esq., commanding, from Aspinwall on the 19th inst. with the California mails of the 5th inst., treasure and passengers brought down by the Pacific Mail steamship John L. Stephens, arrived at this port yesterday morning.

docs.snippet: Mr. MERIAM published a letter in the Courier and Enquirer, yesterday morning, in which he stated that be had "received a letter from Governor TOUCEY, Secretary of the Navy, and had addressed him a fourth communication, saying that Mayor Tiemann will...
docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. MERIAM published a letter in the Courier and Enquirer, yesterday morning, in which he stated that be had "received a letter from Governor TOUCEY, Secretary of the Navy, and had addressed him a fourth communication, saying that Mayor Tiemann will dismiss the prosecution against the officers of the pestilence frigate Susquehanna, if that vessel will go to the North Sea."

headline.main: FROM UTAH AND THE WEST.; Probabilities of a Peaceful Result--Brigham Young likely to Retreat--Lack of Military Material--Condition of the Females, &c. ACTION OF THE KANSAS PEOPLE. Interesting from Salt Lake City -- Escape of a Disgusted Mormon.

docs.snippet: The Quarantine buildings at Seguine's Point were entirely destroyed by fire during Sunday night. The buildings, which were erected about eight months ago--tw hospitals, a wash house, and a small cock-house--were of wood, the walls filled in with...

headline.main: The Quarantine Buildings at Seguine's Point Burned.; NO CLUE TO THE INCENDIARIES.

docs.abstract: The new buildings at Seguine's Point burned
docs.lead_paragraph: The Quarantine buildings at Seguine's Point were entirely destroyed by fire during Sunday night. The buildings, which were erected about eight months ago--tw hospitals, a wash house, and a small cock-house--were of wood, the walls filled in with brick resting on brick foundations.

docs.snippet: PETER B. SWEENEY, Esq., has gone to Europe for his health. Tile duties of the District-Attorney's office. during his absence, will be performed by Mr. SEDGWICK, assisted by the Hon. JOHN McKEOS. The Police Commissioners have reconsidered their action...
docs.lead_paragraph: PETER B. SWEENEY, Esq., has gone to Europe for his health. Tile duties of the District-Attorney's office. during his absence, will be performed by Mr. SEDGWICK, assisted by the Hon. JOHN McKEOS. The Police Commissioners have reconsidered their action suspending Captains LEONARD and DOWLING. of the old force. Both are efficient officers, and will, we trust, be restored to tile service.

docs.snippet: Mr. SEWARD, of New-York, presented a petition from JAMES C. JEWEIT, asking that a demand be made on the Government of Peru for non-fulfillment of its engagement in reference to the Lobos Islands, Referred to the Committee on Claims. Mr. YULEE, of...

headline.main: XXXVth CONGRESS......First Session.; SENATE. HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. SEWARD, of New-York, presented a petition from JAMES C. JEWEIT, asking that a demand be made on the Government of Peru for non-fulfillment of its engagement in reference to the Lobos Islands, Referred to the Committee on Claims. Mr. YULEE, of Florida, presented a petition from EDWARD D TIPPET for aid to test his "cold-water steate engine." Referred to the Committee on Commerce.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; City Mortality. BOY RUN OVER AND KILLED. IN PEARL-STREET. DROWNED MAN RECOGNIZED. DEATH FROM DELIRIUM TREMENS. The Quarantine Convention. Coroners' Inquests.

docs.lead_paragraph: The following is the weekly report of deaths in the City and County of New-York, from the 17th day of April to the 24th day of April, 1858. Men, 74; Women, 91; Boys, 115; Girls, 119; Total, 390 Adults, 165; Children, 234 ; Males, 189 ; females, 210 ; Colored persons. 10.

headline.main: ARRIVAL OF SCANDINAVIAN MORMONS IN NEW-YORK.; Won't they say of Mormon in Denmark, Swedan and Norway.

docs.abstract: Arrival of Scandinavian Mormons at NY
docs.lead_paragraph: A company of ninety ??, eighty-one of them from Sweden. Denmark and Norway, and nine from England, arrived at this port on Saturday, on ?on. The Scandinavian partion of this comoany had their rez-dezuous at convert, in Denmark, where seventy eight adults and children, from the different conferences or districts of the country over which the Normans are ?? in small communities, each presided over by an elder,
